title: Traditional Rub for St. Louis Ribs

Ingredients.9: 2 racks Smithfield® Extra Tender St. Louis Pork Spareribs, membrane removed

Ingredients.11: 1 cup Handful hickory or apple wood chips for smoking, soaked in water and drained

Ingredients.12: 0.75 cup apple juice, in a spray bottle

Directions.1: About one hour before smoking, make the dry rub. Combine sugar, paprika, mustard, salt, garlic, onion powder and coriander in small bowl; mix well. Coat both sides of ribs with a little vegetable oil and sprinkle with seasoning rub. Set aside at room temperature for 1 hour.

Directions.2: Heat charcoal or gas grill for indirect cooking at 230 to 250 degrees F. Add drained wood chips, if using.

Directions.3: Place the ribs, meaty side down, over a drip pan and cook for 2 hours. If desired, spray both sides of ribs with apple juice. Add about 12 coals to a charcoal grill every 45 minutes or so to maintain the heat.

Directions.4: Remove ribs from grill. Double-wrap each rack in heavy-duty aluminum foil. Return wrapped ribs to the grill and cook for 1 1/2 to 3 hours more over indirect heat, until very tender. Add more coals as needed to maintain temperature for a charcoal grill.
